worklogs.comment:
lidavidm commented on PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#issuecomment-1185506003

   Also: does your project maintain a CI test of the nightly Arrow release or Arrow HEAD? I'd just like to note that 9.0.0 is not yet formally released

jinchengchenghh commented on PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#issuecomment-1185510913

   Here is our [gluten ](https://github.com/oap-project/gluten)project.
   These files include it:
   https://github.com/oap-project/gluten/blob/main/cpp/src/jni/jni_wrapper.cc
   https://github.com/oap-project/gluten/blob/main/cpp/velox/jni/jni_wrapper.cc
   
   use the schemaByte and other functions, you can search `arrow::dataset::jni::` for more references
   Thanks for your reply @lidavidm

jinchengchenghh commented on PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#issuecomment-1185515644

   We are working to switch from our forked [branch ](https://github.com/oap-project/arrow)to Apache Arrow master
   After this PR merged, we will switch CI test to Apache Arrow master branch.
   It is good to have our fixes in next release, so we can use a stable version.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#issuecomment-1185523683

   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-17086

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#issuecomment-1185523711

   :warning: Ticket **has not been started in JIRA**, please click 'Start Progress'.

lidavidm commented on code in PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#discussion_r923669717


##########
java/dataset/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt:
##########
@@ -63,3 +63,6 @@ add_arrow_test(dataset_jni_test
                jni_util.cc
                EXTRA_INCLUDES
                ${JNI_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+               
+install(FILES jni_util.h
+        DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset")

Review Comment:
   It looks like this fails the linter: https://github.com/apache/arrow/runs/7357633145?check_suite_focus=true#step:5:864
   
   ```suggestion
            
   install(FILES jni_util.h DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset"
   ```

jinchengchenghh commented on code in PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#discussion_r925226706


##########
java/dataset/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt:
##########
@@ -63,3 +63,6 @@ add_arrow_test(dataset_jni_test
                jni_util.cc
                EXTRA_INCLUDES
                ${JNI_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+               
+install(FILES jni_util.h
+        DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset")

Review Comment:
   Thanks very much! I have fixed this as suggestion.

lidavidm commented on PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#issuecomment-1190278148

   Build failures are already being tracked elsewhere. Thanks @jinchengchenghh

lidavidm merged PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614

kou commented on code in PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#discussion_r926202764


##########
java/dataset/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt:
##########
@@ -63,3 +63,5 @@ add_arrow_test(dataset_jni_test
                jni_util.cc
                EXTRA_INCLUDES
                ${JNI_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+
+install(FILES jni_util.h DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset")

Review Comment:
   Sorry for commenting this after we merge this.
   
   Should we use `arrow/jni/dataset` or something? It seems that `jni/dataset` is too generic path.

lidavidm commented on code in PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#discussion_r926203065


##########
java/dataset/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt:
##########
@@ -63,3 +63,5 @@ add_arrow_test(dataset_jni_test
                jni_util.cc
                EXTRA_INCLUDES
                ${JNI_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+
+install(FILES jni_util.h DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset")

Review Comment:
   Agh, sorry for not being careful. I think it would have been `arrow/jni/dataset` originally right?

lidavidm commented on code in PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#discussion_r926204218


##########
java/dataset/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt:
##########
@@ -63,3 +63,5 @@ add_arrow_test(dataset_jni_test
                jni_util.cc
                EXTRA_INCLUDES
                ${JNI_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+
+install(FILES jni_util.h DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset")

Review Comment:
   Oh, hmm. Indeed, we originally had it under `cpp/src/jni/dataset/jni_util.h`. On the other hand if I peek at a Conda package it's not there (presumably because we don't enable JNI). Perhaps we should make the breaking change and revert this so that downstream packages cannot depend on this accidentally?
   
   @jinchengchenghh, what is the use case for depending on `jni_util.h`?

lidavidm commented on code in PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#discussion_r926204606


##########
java/dataset/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt:
##########
@@ -63,3 +63,5 @@ add_arrow_test(dataset_jni_test
                jni_util.cc
                EXTRA_INCLUDES
                ${JNI_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+
+install(FILES jni_util.h DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset")

Review Comment:
   Ok from what I see above, there are some Arrow utilities that are being used. IMO, they should get vendored into the downstream project.

lidavidm commented on code in PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#discussion_r926206119


##########
java/dataset/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt:
##########
@@ -63,3 +63,5 @@ add_arrow_test(dataset_jni_test
                jni_util.cc
                EXTRA_INCLUDES
                ${JNI_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+
+install(FILES jni_util.h DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset")

Review Comment:
   We could perhaps keep it for 9.0.0 and explicitly break it for 10.0.0 (these should also get refactored into explicit `internal` namespace and header)

pitrou commented on PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#issuecomment-1191130563

   @jinchengchenghh Is there any reason you need to reuse the Arrow JNI headers? They were never meant to be public.
   Ideally you wouldn't need them, instead base your code entirely on the public Arrow C++ and Java APIs (and use the C Data Interface in between if needed).

pitrou commented on code in PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#discussion_r926353925


##########
java/dataset/src/main/cpp/CMakeLists.txt:
##########
@@ -63,3 +63,5 @@ add_arrow_test(dataset_jni_test
                jni_util.cc
                EXTRA_INCLUDES
                ${JNI_INCLUDE_DIRS})
+
+install(FILES jni_util.h DESTINATION "${CMAKE_INSTALL_INCLUDEDIR}/jni/dataset")

Review Comment:
   In any case, there is some ongoing work on the JNI layer to refactor it, base it on the C Data Interface, and try to minimize the amount of custom (and poorly-tested) code. So these are likely to break again.

lidavidm opened a new pull request, #13675:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13675

   PR #13614 installed jni_util.h to match earlier behavior, but
   the downstream Gluten project is no longer depending on it and
   we never intended to expose this header, so don't install it.

lidavidm commented on PR #13614:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13614#issuecomment-1191380088

   See #13675

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

fields.description:
Arrow8 will install jni_util.h, but Arrow9 not, cause [gluten|[oap-project/gluten (github.com)|https://github.com/oap-project/gluten]] project fail when upgraded to Arrow 9

And if use cmake --preset ninja-debug
-DARROW_BUILD_SHARED=ON
-DARROW_GANDIVA_JAVA=ON
-DARROW_GANDIVA=ON
it will failed with this error, fix it
arrow/cpp/src/gandiva/jni/expression_registry_helper.cc:157:78: error: implicit conversion loses integer precision: 'unsigned long' to 'int' [-Werror,-Wshorten-64-to-32]
gandiva_data_types.SerializeToArray(reinterpret_cast<void*>(buffer.get()), size);
fields.summary: [C++] Install java/dataset include file and fix debug build failed by compiler flag
